fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Updating an issue using the quick panel from backlog produces an unexpected refresh in the middle panel.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open backlog (with a huge number of issues)
 # Click an issue and wait for it to open in the right panel
 # Edit the issue using the right panel (i.e. change the Assignee)

h3. Expected Results
The middle panel should remain showing the issue selected, for future usage.

h3. Actual Results
The middle panel is refreshed and then you need to find the issue again in the backlog. This only happens using Chrome browser v95 and v96. The tests were made on version (96.0.4664.93).

h3. Workaround
Use Firefox (tested with v95)
Use Safari (tested with v15.1)


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Backlog middle panel is refreshed when editing issue in Chrome 95 and 96.

fields.description:
When previewing an image, it is possible to zoon in an out using the zoom buttons from the interface, but if a user wants to use the web browser zoom functions, the image will always stay at max size within the max height and width of the window instead of zooming in further. For example:
Image with zoom at 200% in web browser:  !image-2021-12-14-11-31-58-276.png|thumbnail! 
Same image with zoom at 400% in web browser looks the same:  !image-2021-12-14-11-32-22-743.png|thumbnail! 
When using the + zoom button provided by Jira, you actually zoom in the image:  !image-2021-12-14-11-33-51-210.png|thumbnail! 

The request is to allow zooming in the image like it would if the - and + buttons were pressed when using the browser zoom
fields.summary: Allow zooming in images using the web browser zoom

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user performing the action is not logged when adding a user to a group via the admin UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Browse to https://admin.atlassian.com/ -> Product -> Manage users (from the {{...}} option)
 # Add a user to the group

h3. Expected Results
The user performing the operation is recorded in the Jira or Confluence UI and when requesting the audit log events via the {{GET /rest/api/3/auditing/record}} REST API endpoint.

h3. Actual Results
In Jira, the {{Author}} column shows {{JIRA}} as the user who performed the operation:
 !image-2021-12-14-10-36-26-534.png|thumbnail! 

In Confluence, the {{User}} column shows {{System}} as the user who performed the operation:
 !image-2021-12-14-10-37-10-776.png|thumbnail! 

When using the {{GET /rest/api/3/auditing/record}} REST API, no {{authorAccountId}} is returned.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The user performing the action is not logged when adding a user to a group via the admin UI

fields.description:
Please consider tracking it blatantly, or exposing a method to query it, or a report. I'd even take an automation hack at this point, if it was fairly straightforward (most are not and have yet to figure out a smartvalue that will let me rig it, though I'm looking around).

I've been calculating single reopens, but many tickets are being reopened multiple times, which means we have a serious quality problem to address and we aren't able to track it. We need to be able to track it in a way we can prove it to our stakeholders and resourcing team that it's real and actionable.

I found JSWCLOUD-16076, which is Closed. Created in 2017. It's now 2022 almost. While searching for a solution, I found a dozen or more questions in the forums about this topic. There is interest. People are too busy to lurk in the Jira forums to find things to vote on.
fields.summary: As a manager, I would like to track "number of times transitioned to status", so that I can tell if a team is under resourced or taking on too much work during planning
Default filters ('My Open Issues' & 'Open Issues') on Project 'Issues' Page include incorrect 'statusCategory' values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using JIRA import wizard (External System Import) setup for importing issues/tasks from Trello doesn't bring the attachments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# JIRA import wizard (External System Import) 
# Select the option Trello
# Authorize the application access
# Select the Boards you want
# Finish the process

h3. Expected Results
Here's how the issues/tasks are shown in Trello:
 !image-2021-12-13-17-56-31-829.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
This is how the attachment is shown in Jira:
 !image-2021-12-13-17-57-08-388.png|thumbnail! 

 !image-2021-12-13-17-57-37-122.png|thumbnail! 

*Downloading the image doesn't work as well*

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA import wizard doesn't bring attachments from Trello

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Broken help link in custom field configuration screen

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Navigate to Issues, Custom Field, Edit Context Configuration
 # Click on the quetion mark (?) - the link leads to a "page not found"

!Configure_Custom_Field__test_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!

!Configuring_a_custom_field_-_Administering_Jira_Cloud_products_-_Atlassian_Documentation.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Should lead to the following link:

https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-custom-field-context/

h3. Actual Results

Leads to this link: 

!Configuring_a_custom_field_-_Administering_Jira_Cloud_products_-_Atlassian_Documentation.png|thumbnail!


h3. Workaround

Visit the following link for help on custom field context configuration:

https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/configure-custom-field-context/
fields.summary: Clicking help button on custom field configuration screen leads to "page not found"

fields.description:
As of now, we have a few commands available in the new MS team Jira app chatbot.

It would be useful to enable more commands like assign, create, edit, etc. for the chatbot.
fields.summary: Add more commands to the MS Team Chatbots

fields.description:
Hello,

Since the Server version, the "group picker" custom field type behave in the same non-dynamical way.

When will an upgrade be planned? The way it behaves now is not optimal for the user experience.

!image-2021-12-13-14-57-18-386.png!

There is not autocomplete/dynamical propositions.

So we need to type in the exact name of the word, or use the non dynamical group finder

!image-2021-12-13-15-00-34-229.png!

Can you upgrade it so that it behaves just like the group picker in the admin --> user management section, or like the user or component picker?

 

Thanks
fields.summary: Make the "group picker" custom field behave like the user picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After Chrome is upgraded to v96, the issue's comments, status, estimates, assignees and issue status are no longer auto-updated.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in Browser
 # Ask another person to open the same issue from a different browser with another account.
 # Ask the person to update the issue, for instance, add a comment.


h3. Expected Results
When another user updates a field (i.e. adds a comment) the comment is expected to be refreshed on your screen. 
This [video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/jkuEBG8G] shows the expected behavior in Chrome 91 


h3. Actual Results
The comment is not refreshed.
We can see that the issue time is refreshed (the comment timer is refreshed if you add a comment)
A browser refresh needs to be performed in order to bring new comments made by other users.


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: After upgrading to Chrome 96, issues no longer auto-refresh some fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Make smart commit errors available on a page within the Jira cloud or send smart commit errors in a batch rather than sending individual emails for each error processing smart commits.

This could be annoying for users because Multiple Jira cloud instances can be registered to a Bitbucket cloud workspace. When a Jira key is issued to a commit, it can match with any one of the Jira instances. But Jira sends individual emails "error processing smart commits" from all the Jira instances where the issued Jira key in the commit doesn't match with them. 

Example: If a customer registers 5 Jira instances to their Bitbucket workspace. every time they issue a Jira key to a commit, it will be intended only for a Jira instance. But the customer will receive 4 "error processing smart commits" emails due to the fact that the Jira Key did not match with 4 other Jira instances. If a customer performs more commits, let's say on an average of 10 commits a day, they will get around 40 "error processing smart commits" emails. Also, these emails wouldn't be requiring any action from the users.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Integrate the first Jira instance (eg: test1.atlassian.net) to Bitbucket workspace (eg: mc-labs-test)
 * Integrate the second Jira instance (test2.atlassian.net) to workspace mc-labs-test
 * Created a commit with an issue key (eg:MCTRY-1) which only exists in the second Jira instance (test2.atlassian.net)
 * The Jira issue key MCTRY-1 link is pointing to second Jira instance (test2.atlassian.net) correctly
 * After that, we will also get the email notification as below: 

"There was an error processing your smart commit". MCTRY-1 will be pointing to test1.atlassian.net in the email.
h3. Expected Results

It is an expected result to send individual emails for each error processing smart commit. But It will be annoying for customers and they do not anticipate receiving such emails when multiple Jira cloud instances (2 or more)  are registered to their Bitbucket cloud workspace and each commit issued with a Jira key will send such emails.
h3. Workaround

No workaround to block smart commit error emails
fields.summary: Make smart commit errors available on a page within the Jira cloud or send smart commit errors in a batch rather than sending individual emails for each error processing smart commits.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to run a JQL e.g. "type = bug" or using another field ("assignee = currentUser") the message 
"Field 'type' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it." appears.
The user performing the search is in group site-admins and as the documentation says it should have all permissions for the Jira Cloud instance

Curious is that in the following 2 cases the query works as expected without errors: 
- if at least one Scrum project exists on that instance
- if the user is in both "site-admins" and  "jira-administrators" group ("site-admins" group includes Jira Software Product with Product Role = User and Jira Administration product with Product Role = Product admin, "jira-administrators" group includes Jira Administration with Product admin role)

Note: If the user is in both "site-admins" and "jira-administrators" groups but the product Jira Software in "site-admins" group is missing (only Jira Administration with Product admin role is included), the error is shown again. Same happens if the user is only in the "jira-administrators" group (which again includes only Jira Administration with Product admin role).


Edit: Running the same query on a newly created Jira Cloud instance also gives the same error with the user being added by default to the “site-admins” group since he is the owner (no projects were created).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# have a Jira instance without any software project
# log in as site-admin
# try to search in JQL by field type "bug": "type = bug"

h3. Expected Results
empty list of issues is returned

h3. Actual Results
error/message appears: "Field 'type' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching in JQL returns "Field 'type' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We are facing issue with our marketplace app installation. When app is installed from the "Apps" menu we choose our app and open it - the app does not load. Instead shows atlassian error and whitescreen.

Iframe is never loaded, therefore I think the issue is not on our side since our app never gets to be loaded. It is automatically fixed once page is refreshed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Go to App => Manage your apps
2. Install app from marketplace => search for "Zumvie" and install it
3. Then go to App => Zumvie People

h3. Expected Results
App onboarding page should be showed

h3. Actual Results
Loading circle at first, then white screen and error from atlassian. Iframe is never loaded.

Error showed by Jira:
```
Something's gone wrong

Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support.
ERROR: 5NW4OF
```

There are couple *screenshots in the attachments *that might help to figure out the issue.
After the website is refreshed everything works fine, but if you don't do it nothing ever loads.


h3. Workaround
After the website is refreshed everything works fine, but if you don't do it nothing ever loads.
fields.summary: Installing marketplace app gives 404 on first open

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We are unable to create child issues under Epic issue in the Jira MacOS Desktop application. In the application UI, there is an option to create sub-tasks under Epic issues instead of standard type child issues

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Download the Jira cloud desktop application for MacOS
2. In a Company Managed project, create a new Epic issue
3. Try to create a child issue under the Epic issue

h3. Expected Results
End users should be able to create standard type child issues under Epic issues (Example: Story, Task, Bug)

h3. Actual Results
End users are prompted to create subtasks instead of child issues

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to create child issues under Epic issue in the Jira MacOS Desktop application

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inviting users from the user interface with such emails is working:
имейлНаКирилица@primer and 🎵@primer.com
All the above can be invited from the user interface in Jira Cloud and also can be created in Jira DC.
However when you try to create any by using the REST API:
POST /rest/api/3/user
The server will respond with 500

h3. Steps to Reproduce
try to create user with following emails via rest api "/rest/api/3/user"
имейлНаКирилица@primer and 🎵@primer.com

h3. Expected Results
user created

h3. Actual Results
{code}
Response{protocol=http/1.1, code=500, message=Internal Server Error, url=https://.....atlassian.net//rest/api//3//user}
Response Body: {"errorMessages":["The request failed. We're not sure what went wrong. Try again and if the problem persists, contact Jira support."],"errors":{}}
{code}
What is expected is to have the same behavior for both UI and REST API or the API to not respond with 500 and have a valid message.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior (other than creating users via UI).
A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating user with valid email via rest api fails with 500

fields.description:
In team-managed software project, when the customer use the custom field "People" in Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget, the result doesn't give the correct value. 

We need Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget support "People" custom field and the other custom field type on X and Y axes.
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget support the custom field "People" in team-managed software project

fields.description:
Currently we have to add one comment at a time from MS Teams to a Jira issue, which is not feasible if you have to add a great amount os comments.

It would be better if we have the ability to enable MS Teams to automatically add to a Jira ticket the comments that flow from a thread that was created by Jira.
fields.summary: Enable MS Teams to automatically add comments to a Jira ticket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user language is set to French, date picker fields don't accept the data selected from Calendar
The date picker will return the value {{08/Dec/21 5:32 PM}}, once you submit the form data the following error will be shown:
- {code}Format de date non valide. Veurillez saisir la date au format dd/MMM/yy h:mm a'{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Check the video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/yAu0JnoW

* Change the user language to French
* Add the due date and start date fields to the create issue screen (Or any other date picker field)
* Select a date from the calendar for one of the date picker fields

h3. Expected Results
JIRA accepts the date format returned by the date picker

h3. Actual Results
The below error is shown when you try to create the issue:
{code}Format de date non valide. Veurillez saisir la date au format dd/MMM/yy h:mm a'{code}

h3. Workaround

Change the month to French by typing it IN lower case ({{08/déc./21 5:32 PM}}) 
Change the user language to English.
fields.summary: Date picker field doesn't work correctly in French when creating issue.

fields.description:
Currently, a user without the global Browse users and groups permission can see and assign tickets to the users with the assignable user permission on each project.

But this behavior is restricted to the assignee field, it would be helpful to have the same behavior for other user picker fields.

This will allow users to select other users in user picker fields without seeing all the users from the instance.
fields.summary: Allow user to browse users and groups for user picker fields based on project permissions

fields.description:
The customer would like the ability to sort and filter the Column STATUS.

This is so they can group their request and focus on the status they want to work on.
fields.summary: Allow Customers to Sort Current Requests by STATUS Column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Editing the Issue Type using Automation for Jira to convert a Sub-Task to a Task does not remove the sub-task to task relation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation Rule that Edits the Issue Type field and set it to TASK.
 # Run this rule in a Sub-Task.

h3. Expected Results

Issue converted to sub-task and relation to parent task removed.
h3. Actual Results

Only the issuetype changes. Issuelinks and parent task remains:
 * !image-2021-12-09-17-12-17-098.png|thumbnail!
 * !image-2021-12-09-17-12-45-972.png|thumbnail!
 * When trying to Convert it back to Sub-Task, we get an error message:
!image-2021-12-09-17-17-14-235.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Automation to support converting a Sub-Task to a Task (and vice versa)

fields.description:
Currently, the Watcher field has a limited context that can only be used through the advanced search at the Issue Navigator, however, by changing to the basic search, the Watcher field is not even an option

Please, make the Watcher field useable through basic searches on Issue Navigator.
fields.summary: Ability to use Watcher field through Basic Search

fields.description:
Problem definition:
Currently, there is no option to merge two or more user groups.

Suggested Solution:
Add an option to merge two or more user groups into one.

Why is this important:
When managing large amounts of users and groups this feature will provide flexibility to merge two groups and replace the tedious process of moving many users from one to another group.

Workaround:
Manually add users from one group to the other before deleting it.
fields.summary: Merging two or more user groups in User management

fields.description: When a page gets archived in Confluence, the link in Jira issue view changes from displaying the page title to "We couldn't load this page. Open in Confluence". This makes the Confluence pages section in Jira highly unusable, as you cannot differentiate between different Confluence pages directly from Jira.
fields.summary: Links to archived Confluence pages appear broken in Jira

fields.description: All the Date and Date&Time fields follow the same date and time format as per the language settings except the "Date Started" field inside the Time Tracking field.
fields.summary: Time Tracking date format do not obey the time format set as per the Language setting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Status icon URL with dash character breaks issue view in Jira Mobile app

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select a status of your workflow
 # Edit it by adding a URL for the respective icon with a dash and space in it. For example:
{code}
This is a test - test
{code}
# Save the edit

h3. Expected Results
Issues should load fine regardless of the character encoding failure 

h3. Actual Results
Issues can't be loaded in mobile app

h3. Workaround
Remove the - and space or manually change it to encode it as %20
fields.summary: Status icon URL with dash and space characters together breaks issue view in Android Jira app

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

When using the wiki text editor in Jira, the hyperlink function doesn't show the issue key when searching for an issue, only the summary. This may cause confusion to users if they are selecting the right issue:

!image-2021-12-09-09-10-00-315.png|width=454,height=327!
h3. Suggested Solution:

Display the Issue Key along with the Summary when adding a hyperlink.
fields.summary: Display issue key in the search results when using hyperlink in the text editor

fields.description:
It would be great to have a dashboard gadget to display all the projects by project lead along with the issue status.

At the moment we can use the JQL projectsLeadByUser() to get all the issues, however this is not straight forward to use in a gadget as we would have to configure the gadget for each user separately. ( Project Lead field is not available in the gadget). 

Please provide a way to fetch it directly in a gadget.
fields.summary: Dashboard Gadget to display Projects by Project Lead and the Issue statuses.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the system or user language is changed to Portuguese then date fields will stop working correctly.
The date picker will return the value {{08/Dec/21 5:32 PM}}, once you submit the form data the following error will be shown:
- {code}'08/Dec/21 5:32 PM' não é uma data válida. Por favor insira a data no seguinte formato: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a{code}

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Check the video: https://share.getcloudapp.com/2NuP4beW

* Change the user language to Portuguese
* Try starting a sprint
or
* Try logging work

h3. Expected Results
JIRA accepts the date format returned by the date picker

h3. Actual Results
{code}'08/Dec/21 5:32 PM' não é uma data válida. Por favor insira a data no seguinte formato: dd/MMM/yy h:mm a{code}
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
Change the month to Portuguese format lower case ({{08/dez/21 5:32 PM}})
fields.summary: Error data format when start sprint with language portuguese

fields.description: We want to identify the issues that Urgency field has changed. We couldn't do this with JQL.
fields.summary: Allow JQL history search for the Urgency field

fields.description:
In Jira, there is no out-of-the-box field to fetch the records when a comment is added. Request to include Commentedon field in JQL.

Workaround: Customers could use the Scriptrunner add-on that provides the Commentedon field in JQL
fields.summary: Include Commentedon field in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a Jira issue from the Manage App (UPM) screen, the screen freezes right after the issue is created
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open UPM screen
 # Create a new issue while being on that screen

h3. Expected Results

The issue is created and the user is able to use the UPM screen afterwards
h3. Actual Results

The screen freezes right after the issue creation popup is closed
h3. Workaround

Create the issue from any other screen.
fields.summary: Creating Jira issue from "apps management" results in inactive "pane"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This is an inconsistency in the new editor with different behavior between Jira and Confluence, where the Up and Down arrows are scrolling horizontally between columns rather than vertically in Jira but still scroll vertically in Confluence,  the behavior started with an update sometime in late November
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a table to a text field such as a comment in Jira
 # Use up and down arrows to navigate

h3. Expected Results

The cursor position moves vertically in the direction of the arrow key used
h3. Actual Results

The cursor moved left when selecting the Up arrow key and right when selecting the Down arrow key
!Table_error.mp4|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using up and down Arrow keys on a table scrolls horizontally

fields.description:
Currently, Notification sent via Atlassian JIRA shows raw URL path when an Issue-key or a Confluence page link is included in the body of the email sent via JIRA Notification.
There is no way to control this, as in choosing if a user wants to enable Smart Links or Disable it in the emails that they receive from Atlassian Jira products.
h3. *Current Behavior:*

Whenever an email is received from Atlassian JIRA products, and if the email body has a JIRA issue link then it will be always rendered as a raw URL
 * Adding a comment to a ticket that triggers the email notification looks like this: (Converted to Smart Link)
!image-2021-12-08-02-37-35-620.png|thumbnail!
 * Receiving that email looks like this: (Issue links are not rendered as Smart links, but show up as raw URL)
!image-2021-12-08-02-53-04-371.png|thumbnail!

When there are links to pasted in the email body from Confluence pages or when there is a link posted that points at a specific region in the confluence document, the URL can get very huge and that eats up a lot of space in the email body and users cannot see the information at a glance.
 * Adding a Confluence Link in the Issue comment: (Converted to Smart Link)
!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 * Receiving that email looks like this: (Confluence links are not rendered as Smart links, but show up as raw URL)
!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Suggestion:*

Provide an option to the users to choose in their *Personal Settings* if they would like to receive emails notification from JIRA where if the body of the email contains a link to the JIRA issue or a Confluence page, then it can be either rendered as a Smart Link or Rendered as a normal URL path.
fields.summary: Ability to Enable or Disable Smart links in email body received from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The "Your Work" section display tickets with internal URL links even if the user doesn't have internal access to that JSM project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a licensed Jira user (Jira Software for example) that doesn't have Jira Service Management license
# Add this user, as a *customer* on a JSM project
# From the Customer Portal for that JSM project, the user can raise/comment on a ticket
# Now, when this user access Jira internally, and click under "Your Work", the ticket will be displayed
# Clicking on the ticket, will route the user to the Internal view of that ticket, and not to the Customer Portal

h3. Expected Results

Although a licensed Jira user, if the user don't have JSM license or access to the project, the ticket shouldn't show up under "Your Work" with a link taking it to the internal view of the ticket. It should take it to the Customer Portal view.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is being displaying, and clicking on it, will display the following error message "You don't have access to this issue". This might cause some confusion for the user.
 !image-2021-12-07-16-52-12-225.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: "Your Work" section display tickets from projects that the user does not have access to.

fields.description:
When ever we configure a Dashboard gadget using Filter results, the columns are displayed as is from the JQL results.

Please provide a provision to rename the column results so that it would be visible in the dashboard gadget results as well. Please refer screen shot below. The issue type , for example, is displayed as "T", it would be much better if we can configure it as per our convenience.
fields.summary: As an admin it would be great to have column alias for JQL so that it can be used in Dashboard gadgets

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

copy/paste comment works differently in different browsers, firefox keeps the formatting and attachments, other browsers seem to break it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # If a user copies a single comment and marks the selection till ‘{*}edit{*}’ ‘{*}delete{*}’ and ‘{*}emoji icon{*}’ then the formatting is lost when you paste the content into the comment box, please check the video attached below. It does work fine only in Firefox
 # Also, due to this when copying a chain of comments, it can not be pasted in a proper format. The issue occurs when you include edit’ ‘delete’ and ‘emoji icon’ in your selection

 * [^issue while copying the issue.mov]

h3. Expected Results

The copy comments behavior should be the same in all the browsers
h3. Actual Results

Formatting is lost in multiple browsers, Firefox keeps the formatting and attachments, other browsers seem to break it.
h3. Workaround

1. Copy/Paste one by one and do not include the links ‘edit’ ‘delete’ and ‘emoji icon’ in your selection
2. Use Firefox browser
fields.summary: Comments copy/paste doesn't work as expected in some browsers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting an item with no sub select for cascading select field, clicking away does not confirm the selection
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create cascading select field with one option and no sub options
 # Navigate to issue view and select the option from the cascading select field
 # Do not click the confirm nor cancel buttons but click away to confirm the selection

h3. Expected Results

Selection is confirmed.
h3. Actual Results

Cascading select field remains in editing mode.
h3. Workaround

Click on the confirm button.
fields.summary: When selecting an item with no sub select for cascading select field, clicking away does not confirm the selection

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
When a version is archived, users would be able to remove the archived version from the issue view. 

However, refreshing the issue displays the archived version again but this confuses the users and ideally, users should not be able to remove the archived version from the *Fix versions* field

*Suggested solution*
When a version is archived, prevent users from removing the version from the issue view
fields.summary: Users should not be able to remove archived version from the issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Installing add-ons for Jira shows "anonymous" on the audit log instead of actual user
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install and addon
 # Check the Audit Log

h3. Expected Results

User name should be displayed
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes you can only see anonymous

!image-2021-12-06-12-49-28-822.png|width=587,height=201!
h3. Workaround

User will need to contact support to verify on internal logs who installed the addon.
fields.summary: Installing add-ons for Jira shows anonymous on the audit log instead of actual user

fields.description: The ability to archive is only available to premium plan users at double the cost per month. Archiving is a natural way to manage projects for small businesses that do a number of projects across many customers. Asking to archive inactive projects should be a standard feature.
fields.summary: Ability to archive projects in Standard Plan

fields.description:
The project name should not be changed if we switch between projects in browser tabs.

For example - when we open project B in a separate web tab (and not viewing that tab), and if we try to open a ticket from the previous tab itself, in the project list dropdown, project B comes as the first.

The above example shows the expected behavior, however, switching between two browser windows and creating issues from two different contexts should behave based on their context.
fields.summary: The project name in the create issue screen based on the browser context

fields.description:
It would be a good idea to provide a custom field that will list the pre-defined values (which the single select field does) and also allow to put in a different value rather than the ones already defined.

Something like:

!image-2021-12-06-18-42-45-191.png|width=185,height=142!

Here the top three are already defined and available, however, if the user wants to go with a new value of 91, that should allowed.
fields.summary: Option to add a new value to single select custom field.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

While it is possible to block users from logging time spent on issues in a specific state by using the *_jira.permission.work.denied_* workflow property key, this does not account for deleting and editing worklogs.

This means that users who cannot log work on an issue would still be able to modify or delete an existing worklog entry.

h3. Proposed solution

The property blocks users from logging work by restricting the following permissions:

* Work On Issues
* Log Work For Others

This property key should also block users from editing and editing worklog entries by restricting the following permissions:

* Delete All Worklogs
* Delete Own Worklogs
* Edit All Worklogs
* Edit Own Worklogs
fields.summary: Block worklog changes on certain statuses

fields.description:
Hi,

I use Cloud Confluence and Jira on a daily basis. In the browser I usually pin the key tabs, which happen to be Confluence and Jira. It means that I can see only their favicons. I realized that in this setup I have problems quickly distinguishing between these products. Their color set is exactly the same: a dark blue icon on the black background (I am not sure if you can influence the background color). I have to look for a longer moment to realize which is which. In contrast Google is doing it much better. I use their Gmail and Calendar pinned as well. Thanks to different colors used for different services it is immediately clear which pinned tab belongs to which product. I wish it was so simple with Atlassian products.

I propose to use different clearly different color sets for different products.


Regards,

Krzysztof
fields.summary: Different color sets for favicons of different products

fields.description: In Advanced Roadmaps, we would like the ability to re-order the issues linked via Parent Link on an initiative. This functionality exists for ordering stories in an epic, but not for epics in an initiative.
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmaps: Order Initiative based Parent Link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user used in a REST API call to add watchers does not have permissions Jira returns a 401 error code, in the documentation is specified that 403 should return when there are permissions problems
 !image-2021-12-03-16-16-42-338.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove manage watcher permissions to a user
 # Use that user in a REST API call to add a watcher like is defined [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-watchers/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-watchers-post]
 !image-2021-12-03-16-19-26-325.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The error code should be a 403

h3. Actual Results
Jira returns a 401 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When a user in a REST API call does not have permissions to add watchers Jira returns a 401 instead a 403

fields.description: as a user, we would like the possibility to change the Roadmap's title to something we wish.
fields.summary: Ability the change the Roadmap's title

fields.description:
When maximized, the gadget shows a table with the below columns.

Issues Unresolved shows the number of issues that were actually {*}Resolved{*}, so the column name needs to be corrected.

!image-2021-12-03-12-32-45-045.png!
fields.summary: Resolution Time Gadget incorrect column name

fields.description:
h2. Classic projects: Could put formatted content in block quote

With Classic project issues, you could put content on a block quote, which we often used if directly quoting client feedback.
h2. Next Gen: Can't do this

On the Next Gen boards, there is a quote feature in the WYSIWYG editor.

But if you try to make a quote out of something with any additional formatting, like bullet points or inline images, you can’t place that formatted text in the quote.

You can could with the old method.
fields.summary: Next Gen: Formatted block quotes

fields.description:
As we already have automation rules in place for :

Version released, Version created and Version updated rules, it will be great to have Version deleted as well.
fields.summary: Good to have "Version Deleted" automation rule available

fields.description:
In Google Chrome (current version: 96.0), there's a developer toolbox; in that toolbox, there's a tab called 'Lighthouse'.  Lighthouse is a tool that can assess the performance of web pages and makes recommendations on how to speed them up.

It had a lot to say for Jira!

Most notably, there was notice at the top of the report:

 
{noformat}
There were issues affecting this run of Lighthouse:
* The page loaded too slowly to finish within the time limit. Results may be incomplete.
{noformat}
It gave a performance score of 38/100, and the page took 8.2 seconds to become interactive.

There are too many recommendations to list here, so you'll probably want to run it yourself.  It's very informative and the recommendations are clear and concrete.

Hope that helps you; I know it's helped me a lot on my projects!
fields.summary: Make Jira load faster

fields.description:
System apps are installed by anonymous users. Please update the name to the System user

The customer complains that the apps are installed on the Jira site and any update shows that the installation was completed by an Anonymous user. 

Please see this image:

 !image-2021-12-02-10-58-18-725.png|thumbnail! 

Can we please update the name of the user to show a better generic user?
fields.summary: System apps are installed by anonymous user. Please update the name to System user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the value of single/multi select custom field is too long it is truncated and difficult to read. It is more problematic when values of custom field has same prefix.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field of type "single select" or "multi select"
 # Add list of similar options.
!image-2021-12-02-22-04-43-417.png!
 # Add the field to screens.
 # Now create a issue or edit an existing where field created step#1 is present.

As we can see in the example screenshot below it difficult to identified the value of each options. 
!image-2021-12-02-22-09-26-454.png|width=372,height=179!
h3. Suggestion:

There should be an option to extend the width of custom field, or horizontal scroll bar or tooltip so users easily identify what they are selecting.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Option to extend the width of a custom field or provide tooltip that displays full details

fields.description:
h4. Problem definition:

Once a user is deleted a generic *User* label is shown in the comments mentioned. Only manual change of each comment is available.

h4. Suggested Solution:

Allow replacing all mentions in comments from the deleted user to another active user.

h4. Why is this important:

In a company that has employee mobility, flexibility to take over ongoing work is necessary. 

Workaround:
Manually replace all mentioned in comments to a different user.
fields.summary: Replace comment mentioned from a deleted user with an active user.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Assigning tickets using "Balanced workload" is not assigning them evenly

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scheduled automation rule.
# Add the "Assign issue" action.
# Under "Method to Choose Assignee" set as "Balanced Workload".
# Add a JQL to filter the tickets you would like to assign.
# Select a group that has a few users.
# Save the rule and execute.

h3. Expected Results
Tickets should be assigned equally between users of that group. 

For example, if your JQL returns 6 tickets and you have three users on that group we should assign two tickets for each user.

h3. Actual Results
The tickets are not being assigned evenly. For example, some users receive 4 out of 6 tickets returned by the JQL.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assigning tickets using "Balanced workload" is not assigning them evenly

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Customer wants to export the user list with their languages. Using the API /rest/api/3/users/search it was found that, some of the users timezone is not getting displayed with the jira timezone when their personal timezone is not set

h3. Environment
Jira cloud
.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Use API-https://instance.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/users/search
 and then look at the results for users who does not have their personal timezone set

h3. Expected Results
The API results on the browser should display the default timezone of jira in case the user does not have their timezone set.

h3. Actual Results
The API results on the browser returns blank for the users, whose timezone is not set.

h3. Workaround


h3. Notes
fields.summary: Default Jira timezone is not displayed for the user API, when their personal timezone is not set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When an Automation Rule edits an issue that a user is viewing, we get a pop-up notification with the below message:
*Issue Update available!*
_The Issue was Just updated by an Automation rule. Please reload to see the latest change._
This message is not consistent.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule that edits a field upon modifying another field in a project.
 # Open an issue and edit the field that triggers the Automation rule.
 # When the Automation rule edits the issue, we get a pop-up notification with a message mentioned above.

h3. Expected Results
The pop-up notification is expected to be displayed every time there is an edit on an issue.
h3. Actual Results
The pop-up notifications are not consistent for all the edits made on the ticket, and there is no specific pattern for it.

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
NA
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation issue Edit Pop-up notification inconsistency.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changing Date Format for Date Created field under Time tracking window has no effect.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1

Change Language Preferences to another timezone using steps mentioned in article https://support.atlassian.com/atlassian-account/docs/manage-your-language-preferences/

Step 2

Create a new issue in your project. Once the issue is created, click the time tracking field to see if the Date Created field is shown in a new format as per the timezone selected in step1.
h3. Expected Results

The date created field in the time tracking section shows in the new date format.
h3. Actual Results

The date created field in the time tracking section still shows in default date format. Screenshot attached.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing Time Tracking Date Format to another timezone has no effect

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I would like the comment box in the view issue/request screen to 'float' above historical comments in the activity stream, so that I can easily refer to another comment when I'm adding a new comment.

For example, as I begin adding characters to the comment field, it begins to ‘float’ above other comments when scrolling.
fields.summary: Jira issue view comment box to 'float' above comment activity list during comment creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using issue type in an _Issue Fields_ condition for a rule restricted to one team-managed project and one company-managed project, the options shown in drop-down menu consider only company-managed projects options, so they won't work for team-managed projects. 

Besides that, if you first create the rule restricted to a team-managed project, the rule will only consider the options available for this specific team-managed project. If you change the rule's scope to multiple projects, the rule will still consider only the issue types available in the first project.

That's because in the backend issue type id is considered, not issue type name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule that uses issue fields condition with issue type as, for example, issue type equals Bug
 # Restrict the rule scope to multiple projects, one being a team-managed and other a company-managed project
 # Use a team-managed project issue as trigger
 # You can see that even though the issue has Bug as issue type, the condition won't match

h3. Expected Results

The drop-down menu should list all the possible "Tasks"/ "Bugs" issue types ids, including the ones created in team-managed projects. This could be done by adding besides the issue type name the team-managed project name.
h3. Actual Results

By now, id is used as reference in the backend, and when using multiple projects in one automation rule, this fails since the rule will consider only id from one specific project or from company-managed projects.
h3. Workaround

If you're using a multiple projects rule, you can use a JQL condition with a query similar to the one below, which will include all possible ids for a issue type like, for example, "Task":
{code:java}
issuetype in (10001, 10345){code}
To find out the id of the target issue types, you can use [https://[site].atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issuetype], by replacing [site] by the name of your site.
fields.summary: Issue fields condition should shown project name besides issue type name in drop-down menu for issue type field

fields.description:
I realize that there was a previous ticket that was created and closed (for inactivity) on this suggestion (JRACLOUD-36636) but this request was made back in 2014. 

Now, in 2021, more and more people are shifting from Jira Server to Jira Cloud (given the sunsetting taking place next Feb) so this feature should be reassessed for Atlassian's product sprints. 

Companies and project managers are seeking the ability to configure the Dashboards and colors in Jira Cloud with the same look and feel that was setup in Jira Server. This way the user experience is consistent before and after a Cloud migration. 

Thank you for your time reviewing this request.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud needs editable gadget colors in the Look & Feel settings (like Jira Server)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The /rest/api/3/users and /rest/api/3/users/search endpoints are returning a total number of results that is larger than the number of users reported on the user management page

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add 15 users to your site
 # Delete 5 managed accounts out of the 15
 # Install some Jira add-ons
 # Verify that you 10 users reported on the site's user management page. 
 # Use the following endpoint (Return 10 results starting at index 10)

{{/rest/api/3/users?maxResults=10&startAt=10}}

h3. Expected Results

There should be no results as there is only 10 users in the site's user management. 

h3. Actual Results

Results are returned. 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Users rest endpoint returns more results than the user management

fields.description:
We would like a way to bulk add/delete components from JIRA.

With 100 + components deleting them all one by one would be cumbersome.
fields.summary: Bulk add/delete components

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Viewing the attachment in the new issue view changes the name of the attachment.
If the attachment's first letter is lowercase it will be shown as uppercase. 
Numbers are not affected.
 !image-2021-12-01-13-22-50-966.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-12-01-13-23-37-474.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an attachment with the first letter of the name in the lowercase to an issue.
 # Opening the attachment the preview will show the first letter of the name capitalized.

h3. Expected Results
Should show the original name.
h3. Actual Results
Changes the name by making the first lowercase letter of the name capitalized. 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Viewing the attachment in new issue view changes the first letter from lowercase to uppercase.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I know that the API is deprecated, but at least a meaningful error code should be returned.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Having an instance with 1000+ projects
 # Call /rest/api/2/project{*}?properties=whatever{*}

h3. Expected Results

1000+ projects with the entity properties are returned or request fails with a meaningful error message.
h3. Actual Results

{{HTTP 500}} is returned
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Calling the /rest/api/2/project?properties=whatever on the instances with 1000+ projects fails with HTTP 500

fields.description:
At the moment in the Team Managed projects with Private or Limited access, the Issue View only lists the assignable users that the user recently interacted with so have to manually type the user's name to search for the assignable users.

In the backlog view, it lists all the assignable users. 

This is confusing the users and would like to have the same consistency as the backlog.
fields.summary: Team Managed projects with Private or Limited access to list all the Assignable users in the Issue View like it does in the Backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Default Reporter is set for an incoming mail handler, it's not possible to disable it and enable Create User option instead.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Incoming Mail Handler through Jira Settings > System > Mail
 # Enable Default Reporter option and save it
 # Click on Edit in the mail handler you've just created
 # Remove the Default Reporter value
 # Check Create User option to enable it

You'll notice that the spin will be shown after clicking on Save but nothing changes, the value for Default Reporter is kept and Create User option is not enabled.

h3. Expected Results

Create User option should be enabled and Default Reporter should be disabled.

h3. Actual Results

The value for Default Reporter is kept and Create User option is not enabled.

h3. Workaround

You may create a brand new mail handler and automatically set Create User option instead of Default Reporter option.
fields.summary: Not possible to enable Create User option for mail handler if Default Reporter option is set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for exact phrases with hyphens using JQL fetches not exact values. According to our public documentation hyphen is not a special character and should be usable to match exact searches using JQL

This is only occurring searching data on the Development panel.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a Development integration with Jira.
 ## e.g. Jira and Github
 # Setup environments with a hyphen
 ## e.g. "Test-123"
 # Setup another environment with this field set to any variation of this value
 ## e.g. "TestABC-123"
 # Create a JQL advanced search trying to match this field value
 ## e.g. deploymentEnvironmentName ~ "\"Test-123\""
 # The result will bring both issues, not only the one with the exact match.

h3. Expected Results

JQL should fetch only exact results.
h3. Actual Results

The search fetches all combinations of the value, not only exact match.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

There are a couple of marketplace apps that can help work around this problem.
fields.summary: Searching for exact phrases with hyphen using JQL fetches not exact values - Development Panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no way to access some user attributes as Organization through smart values.
h3. Expected Results

As an Automation for Jira user, it would be great to be able to access the following user attributes:
 * Display name
 * Email address
 * Organization
 * Job title
 * Timezone
 * Department
 * Preferred language

h3. Actual Results

For now, Automation for Jira can access only the following user data when setting up a rule and use it in a condition component (for example):
 * accountId: the unique ID of the user, set by Jira. It is not possible to change this ID. 
 * active: whether the user's account is active or not
 * avatarUrls: provides access to the user's avatar images in sizes 16x16, 24x24, 32x32 & 48x48
 * displayName: the full name in the user's profile
 * emailAddress: the email address in the user's profile
 * timeZone : the time zone based on the location set in the user's profile.

Please see https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/smart-values-users/
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: As an Automation for Jira user, I want to be able to access user attributes as Organization through smart values

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Allow exporting of issues in an encoding other than UTF-8. More details in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62624
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export issues as CSV
 # Open CSV in Excel

h3. Expected Results

Characters are rendered without issues or "?"s
h3. Actual Results

"?" characters shown
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-62624 mentions a workaround however I'm not sure if it is successful given the comments there.
fields.summary: CSV Export in other encoding than UTF-8
User displayed as removed in CSV exports even though it is active

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64025].
  {panel}

h3. Problem 
When user log work for a date that is different from the actual time, the CSV export only shows actual date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log work for a different date than the current time
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-07 at 4.37.09 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Export this issue using the *Export Excel CSV (All fields)*
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-07 at 4.32.57 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# Check the work log fields on the exported file

h3. Expected Results
You can find the log work date.

h3. Actual Results
You can only see the date when the log work was submitted.

 !Screen Shot 2017-02-07 at 4.35.04 PM.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2017-02-07 at 4.36.07 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

There are some possible workarounds to get the correct value:
* The endpoint [Get issue worklogs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-worklogs/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-worklog-get] returns the field *started*, which is the field that contains the date entered in the log work rather than the date from when the entry was created
* The [endpoint to perform advanced searches|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-search/#api-rest-api-3-search-get] is able to return the worklog field, and it will contain the *started* value as well
** E.g. /rest/api/3/search?jql=filter=10014&fields=key,worklog
* Our [integration with Google Sheets|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] offers the option to export the *started* value as well. Although if you need the worklogs in order to import values into a Jira instance it would require some manual work to merge the cells correctly:
 !Screen Shot 2021-11-26 at 10.26.40.png|thumbnail!  !Screen Shot 2021-11-26 at 10.28.16.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: When user log work for a date that is different from the actual time, the CSV export only shows actual date.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When exporting issues that are part of an Epic using the Excel format, the Epic Link is being displayed as the Epic ID rather than the Epic name while the UI shows the Epic name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic
# Create several new issues under this new Epic
# Export the issues to Excel.

h3. Expected Results
The Epic Link column should have the Epic name.

h3. Actual Results
The Epic Link is displayed as the Epics ID.
fields.summary: Epic Link exported as Epic ID when using Excel Excel option.

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When viewing the exported CSV file in Excel, the special characters aren't rendered correctly.
h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create an issue with special characters
 # Go to Issue Navigator and click Export > Current fields
 # Open the exported CSV in Excel

h3. Expected Behaviour

The special characters are displayed properly.
h3. Actual Behaviour

Special characters are not correctly rendered. As an example, "phố xưa" is displayed as "phá»‘ xÆ°a" when viewed in Excel.

h3. Workaround
Option 1:
# Open the file with Notepad
# Choose *File > Save as*
#* File name: jira.csv (any name but must end with *.csv*)
#* Save as type: All files
#* Encoding" UTF-8
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Option 2:
# Open the exported CSV file with Notepad++
# Under "Encoding", it should be shown File is UTF-8 without BOM. 
# Converting the file to UTF-8 with BOM will allow the file to be displayed correctly in Excel.
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

+Note:+
Viewing the CSV in text editor works fine.
fields.summary: Special Characters Exported via CSV not Rendered Correctly in Excel

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * When trying to import a csv file with these specific columns (Project name, Summary, Assignee, Due date, Resolved date and (sum of time spent)) and despite clicking on "current field" option other columns are added.
 * The added columns are specifically: (Project key , Project type , Project lead , Project description)
 * User has to remove these options manually because user does not want them to show up in the report. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter.
 # Choose the columns you want to show up.
 # choose export csv with "current field" option.

h3. Expected Results
 * See only the columns chosen at step 2.

h3. Actual Results
 * The columns related to the project info (Project key , Project type , Project lead , Project description) are added by default despite clicking on the "current field" option when exporting.

h3. Workaround
 * The customer has to make the change manually.

h3. Note
When having "Project Name" column in the filter , will added the additional field below :-
** Project Key
** Project type
** Project type
** Project lead
** Project description
** Project URL
When having "Key" column in the filted , will added the additional field below:-
** Issue id
fields.summary: Exporting CSV with "current field" option is adding other columns by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting a csv file with all fields, 500 error is returned

h3. Environment
 * This bug is confirmed to happen in an instance that has 500+ custom fields


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for 1000+ issues
 # Select "Export" > "Export Excel CSV (all fields)"

h3. Expected Results

The issues will be exported
h3. Actual Results

"ERR_INVALID_RESPONSE" error is shown. Checking the browser log, a 500 error is returned for https://<instance>.atlassian.net/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-csv-all-fields/temp/SearchRequest.csv?jqlQuery=<JQL query>&tempMax=<number of issues>

h3. Workaround
 * Export the Excel with current fields
 * Set up a filter with the columns configured([https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/save-your-search-as-a-filter/]) and share it with the users as necessary
fields.summary: When exporting a csv file with all fields, 500 error is returned

fields.description:
h3. Issue:

CSV export for the worklog contains the lower username of the user.
Importing the issues to a different instance causes the worklog to be added by an anonymous user.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

# Log work on a Jira issue
# CSV export the issue with all fields
# In the CSV file notice that you'll see the lower username as the author of the worklog
# CSV import issue to another instance with summary and map the worklog field
# Notice the user is anonymous in the work logged

h3. Expected Result:
CSV export for the worklog should contain the Atlassian Account ID just like the author of the comments.

h3. Actual Result:
CSV export contains the lower username and it results in anonymous worklog entries when imported to another instance.

h3. Workaround:
Replace the lower username with the Atlassian account ID of the user.
fields.summary: CSV export for the worklog contains the lower username of the user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Export (CSV, Current Fields) for Next Gen project issue will display multiple columns for custom field when there's another next gen project using the same custom field *Name*. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a next gen project
 # Add "short text" field to the issue type/request type. Use *Test Field* name.
 # Then , create a test ticket and add the value.
# Then , open another next gen project.
# Add "short text" field to the issue type/request type. Use *Test Field* name.
# Then , go to "Issue Navigator" page and filter issue for one next gen project.
# Then , export the issue using "Export (CSV, Current Fields)"

h3. Expected Results
The *Test Field* column only display one

h3. Actual Results

The *Test Field* column display twice.

h3. Workaround
* Use *Export (CSV, All Fields)*
* Change the other field name to a different name.
fields.summary: Export (CSV, Current Fields) for Next Gen project issue will display multiple column for custom field

fields.description:
Currently, the custom field *checkbox* or the *Drop down list* in team managed projects is only limited to 55 options. 

A suggestion would be to increase it to allow users to have more options to be selected
fields.summary: Increase Checkbox/Drop down list Limit for Team Managed Projects

fields.description:
For example, if there is a workflow change it would be nice to be able to write a custom push notification to communicate this that would just be in product, not email. 

This could also be utilized during migrations as admins can utilize the custom notifications to communicate a change or when a new Atlassian product is brought into the fold. 

It would be even cooler to be able to customize a tour for end-users when onboarding. It would also be cool to customize tours based on these changes. So an admin could create an onboarding experience in the product to familiarize a team or small sub-set of users on new changes or features, etc.
fields.summary: customize change communications by using in product push notifications/ tours

fields.description:
As users, we would like to send alerts of some variety when a specific account is logged into.

At the moment we don't have a webhook to allow this type of notification, so it would be nice to have one to be able to create custom notifications or issues or trigger automation when a specific user logs in.
fields.summary: Send notification once a specific user logins

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The request participant field is not being populated when you include the field as a secondary field to be edited during the automation run.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
!Screen Shot 2021-11-29 at 12.39.46 PM.png|thumbnail!
!Screen Shot 2021-11-29 at 12.20.43 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
The request participant field should be populated.

h3. Actual Results
The request participant field is not being populated.

h3. Workaround
The workaround is by adding the participant via automation during the issue creation.
fields.summary: Request Participants field not populated on the create issue automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to copy content from Slack to a Jira issue, which will recognize the formatting such as URLs, bold, etc.

Currently, if you copy both the content (message) and the user related information (name, avatar) and paste that into Jira, you will not be able to save it.

See the recording:  [^Copy from Slack error.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Select and copy content from Slack, including the message and the user information
* Paste it into an issue's description
* Try to save the content

h3. Expected Results

The content will be saved. If there is unsupported content within the information you have pasted into the issue, the editor should remove it and save the content without the formatting that's causing the problem.

h3. Actual Results

You cannot save the content, and an error message will be displayed:
{code}
We couldn't save your content

I may contain formatting we don't recognize. Try removing the formatting before saving.
{code}
The error message does not point to where the error is coming from either.

h3. Workaround

* Do not copy the user's information along with the message
* Or remove the information that came with the user's name and avatar. Save the content again.
* Or paste the content first to a text editor, copy from the editor and paste to Jira
fields.summary: Copying content from Slack into a text field might result in error

fields.description:
Hello Team,

The admin for the site reported that one of her users is not able to access requests for the Jira Software project.
So, we guided the user that a Jira Software License is needed to access the tickets for the software project.

They found information in the following documentation:
[https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/permissions-for-company-managed-projects/]

Browse Projects
"This permission doesn't depend on specific product access to be useful. You may grant this permission to anyone logged in to your Jira site."

The user understanding for the above sentence is as follows: (Thus, no where does it say that anyone logged in are users with licenses, product access == license, the article clearly states that access to any product is not required to use the Browse Projects permission, thus no licenses are required to use the Browse Projects permission.)

As the information for the browse project is misleading the customer so can we get this updated?

Thank you
fields.summary: Information for the browse project is misleading the customer

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Issue Layout does not follow the screen configuration. 
Even if the screen configuration is empty like below,
 !image-2021-11-29-18-10-15-968.png|thumbnail! 

Fields still show up on the Issue Layout.
 !image-2021-11-29-18-11-14-103.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
If there are default fields on the Issue Layout, let the users know in the screen configuration. 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Issue Layout does not follow the screen configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Basic Search doesn't show custom field options even if the custom field has options available for projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two Jira projects (ProjectA. ProjectB)
 # Create a checkbox field
 # Tie the field created in Step 2 to the projects created in Step 1
 # Set the context like as follows:
{code:java}
<ProjectA> Option: A, B, C
<ProjectB> Option: A, D, E
{code}
Note that option "A" is common in both projects.

 # Go to Basic search
 # Select ProcjetA and ProjectB
 # Add the field created in Step 2 by clicking [+More]
 # Try to add option A

h3. Expected Results

We can select option A
h3. Actual Results

We can see the following error:
{code:java}
Value 'A' is not valid for your current Project(s) and/or Issue Type(s) selection
{code}
h3. Workaround

Use Advanced search JQL
fields.summary: Basic Search doesn't show custom field options that are valid in multiple projects
Language dictionary for Automation

fields.description: [I understand this takes mapping the deployment type of Confluence to the deployment type of Jira] If the capability exists in Confluence (natively) could there just be some internal checking box (maybe a validator or some automated workflow step) that it also exists in Jira natively and Vice Versa? And if not, just add a branch or a post-function to go create that issue? Then in the release notes I'll know what to expect of both applications and where to go vote/watch the stuff I care about.
fields.summary: Capabilities check based on deployment model | Confluence <=> Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have validators configured in your workflows used by sub-tasks the pop-up creation screen is displayed and the quick creation is omitted even if you select one subtask without validators

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a project add 2 sub-task issue types
 # Associate different workflows for each sub-task issue type
 # Add a field validator in one of the workflows creation transition and leave the other without validators
 # Try to create a sub-task selecting the issue type without the validator 

h3. Expected Results
The creation process should use the quick creation feature as the workflow does not have a validator

h3. Actual Results
The creation pop-up screen is displayed instead of the quick creation

h3. Workaround

There is no available workaround but you can click on create and the sub-task will be created without asking for the required fields
fields.summary: Having validators in the sub-tasks workflows causes the quick creation to be ignored

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As of now, there is no a way a customer can see the users who are using a particular 3rd party app.


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if we can provide the organisation admins, the ability to see this data from admin.atlassian.com

h3. Why This Is Important
 This helps the customers to make a decision on whether the app needs to be retained or not. This also gives an insight into the number of users utilising the apps.


h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Usage statistics for third party apps

fields.description:
At the moment, a login to Jira does not send an event that updates the user's last activity timestamp. The end user will need to perform operations in Jira for the last activity timestamp to be updated. 

*Suggestion* : Login to Jira should fire an event that will update the end user's last actitivity timestamp.
fields.summary: Include login in the user's last activity timestamp

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

When Associating an Issue Type with a Screen Scheme, show the Screen Schemes in alphabetical order.

Currently, this is ordered by created/ updated date asc.

 

!image-2021-11-25-09-35-11-418.png|width=395,height=394!
h3. Other Notes:

*_When associating an issue operation with a screen, it is in alphabetical order, that's why this is raised as a bug._*



!image-2021-11-25-14-41-33-523.png|width=400,height=452!
fields.summary: When Associating an Issue Type with a Screen Scheme, show the Screen Schemes in alphabetical order

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Managing [workflow transitions behavior|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ADMINJIRASERVER/Advanced+workflow+configuration] (conditions, validators, post functions, etc) can only be done through the Jira UI.
Having the ability to edit this configuration through the REST API would be useful when automating some administration tasks.


h3. Suggested Solution
Make it possible to manage workflow transitions behavior (conditions, validators, post functions, etc) through the REST API, similar to the [Workflow transition rules|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-workflow-transition-rules/] in Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: As a Jira administrator I would like to manage workflow transitions behavior through the REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
During issue creation, options selected in a multiple-choice custom field can't see choices selected when moving to the next field

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field (type: Select List (multiple choices))
# Create an issue, select from the choices
# Click 'Create' or click another field
# Check the created issue, the choices selected in step 2 is shown 

h3. Expected Results
* Options selected should remain selected

h3. Actual Results
* Options selected looks like not selected during issue creation but is visible after the issue created

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: During issue creation, options selected in a multiple-choice custom field can't see choices selected when moving to the next field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Dragging over one field inside a Company-Managed Project screen's Issue layout ends up sending over a different one instead and some fields when you drag them over, don't move at all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access a Company-Managed Project screen's Issue layout
# Try moving any custom fields, either to Hidden or up/down
# The field that you are moving is not the one that you select to move. Instead, a different field is moved to Hidden or to the new place (up/down).

h3. Expected Results
The custom field index should be taken into consideration and that field should be moved.

h3. Actual Results

Based on a customer's instance:

1. Let's say we want to move the "Strategic Theme" field to the Hidden fields, which internally has an index of 8:
 !image-2021-11-24-20-10-49-020.png|thumbnail! 

2. We should expect that the field (with a source index of 8) will be moved to the hidden fields, but for some reason the content items selector includes items with the "TAB" type which causes the order to bungle up:
 !image-2021-11-24-20-11-03-349.png|thumbnail! 

3. If we check which field became the "8th" item, it's a different one
 !image-2021-11-24-20-11-12-293.png|thumbnail! 

4. Which results in a different field being added
 !image-2021-11-24-20-11-20-596.png|thumbnail! 

Here's a gif showing this behavior:

 !Issue layout - Jira.gif! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue layout has index issues while using Company-Managed Projects with tabs on screens

fields.description:
While creating a new rule using the Sprint Started trigger and selecting the Board, all Boards are available even the ones not accessible due to the Scope of the Rule.

It would be a good idea to filter the Boards and display only the ones accessible by the Scope of the rule.
fields.summary: Filter available boards depending on the Scope of the rule

fields.description:
As an Admin who receives many access requests for a large org and its contractors, I need to vet each request and currently there is no way in Jira for the user to provide required info (for example, Approving Supervisor). Being able to add whatever required fields we need for the Access Request to be sent would save many hours each month.

.
fields.summary: Admins Can Add Required Fields to Access Request Feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The user is not able to log in to the Jira mobile app as the app by default logs him into the site where no access rights exist.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
Simply install and login into the app

h3. Expected Results
Users should be shown a site picker to choose which site they wish to log in to.
h3. Actual Results
Site Picker is not shown and the user is logged-in to the first site (from the list of sites) by default. As the user has no access right to the first site he is not logged in and the app prompts the user to log in with a different account.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Jira Mobile app 'Site Picker' is not shown when the user logs in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to select value for account field (from Tempo add-on) in bulk issue update

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Tempo timesheet add-on installed and ensure you have a large number of accounts (roughly 4k)
 # Run a JQL to scope the issues which have permission to edit the Account field and try performing a bulk edit.

h3. Expected Results
You should be able to select the value for the Account field.

h3. Actual Results
You are not able to select the value for the Account field as the field is not rendered properly making it impossible to select the new value.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to select value for account field in bulk issue update
